title: How to protect a floppy disk - Quora

response.answer_text: Buy a flash drive.Copy the data off the floppy and onto the flash drive.Throw the floppy in the trash.This is only partly in jest. The only thing you can really do with floppy disks is try to keep them as dust-free as possible, but no matter how you look at it they are pretty fragile. I would not trust data to them long-term when you can use something better.

The question is ambiguous. Floppies have a write protection mechanism that on 3.5 disks was a switch that you could turn on and off. On older versions it was a cutoff that you could cover with non-transparent adhesive tape. Physically 3.5 inch disks needed lite protection, mainly against dirt in a pocket. 5.25 inch ones came with a paper sleeve but they could bend easily so some extra protection probably was needed.
